class_notes:
This course, designed for IDS and American studies majors in the Institute for the Liberal Arts (ILA), will help you get started on your senior thesis, giving you time and space to begin thinking and researching while assembling the skills and writing pieces that will lead to a successful outcome next year. You are at the beginning of a one-year process; your senior thesis research begins now. In this phase, you will:
1) identify a research topic
2) begin to collect materials for it
3) construct a research design
4) meet and learn from ILA faculty and staff 
5) identify College and ILA faculty with whom you will work 
6) write a detailed thesis proposal that will serve as the blueprint for your senior thesis 
7) develop a strong and mutually supportive cohort (you will all take the Senior Seminar in the fall)
8) present a 5-7 minute PowerPoint proposal to the ILA and any interested attendees at the annual ILA Spring Undergraduate Research Symposium
By the end of this semester, you should know what you need to do to produce a satisfying and academically sound project next year.
course_description:
Required of AMST and IDS majors spring semester of junior year, this course focuses intensively on the design and initiation of the senior research process. Students' projects are honed, refined, workshopped--bibliography, outline, budget, etc. Students are readied for
required senior year research.
